info.name: Gunslinger
info.description: A lone cowboy wondering the frontier, a genius with a knack for the destructive, a battle tested hero who likes to go in loud with metaphorical and literal guns blazing. All of these could be considered gunslingers
info.author: Matthew Mercer

description.p: Most warriors and combat specialists spend their years perfecting the classic arts of swordplay, archery, or polearm tactics. Whether duelist or infantry, martial weapons were seemingly perfected long ago, and the true challenge is to master them.

However, some minds couldn’t stop with the innovation of the crossbow. Experimentation with alchemical components and rare metals have unlocked the secrets of controlled explosive force. The few who survive these trials of ingenuity may become the first to create, and deftly wield, the first firearms.

This archetype focuses on the ability to design, craft, and utilize powerful, yet dangerous ranged weapons. Through creative innovation and immaculate aim, you become a distant force of death on the battlefield.
Should this path of powder, fire, and metal call to you, keep your wits about you, hold on to your convictions as a fighter, and let skill meet luck to guide your bullets to strike true.

Upon choosing this archetype at 3rd level. you gain proficiency with Tinker’s Tools, when used in relation to firearms your proficeincy becomes expertise. You may use them to craft specialty ammunition, repair damaged firearms, or even draft and create new ones (DM’s discretion). Some extremely intricate and experimental firearms are only available through crafting.

sheet.description: Use Tinker’s Tools to craft specialty ammunition, repair damaged firearms, or even draft and create new ones. You have expertise on checks related to firearms with your tools.

description.p: Also starting at 3rd level, you gain a number of grit points equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1). You can spend grit points to perform various "shot" attacks with your firearms. An attack can only be affected by a single shot feature. You can regain spent Grit points in the following ways:
Critical hit with a firearm. Each time you score a critical hit with a firearm attack, you regain 1 spent grit point.
Killing blow with a firearm. Each time you reduce a dangerous creature of significant threat (DM’s discretion) to 0 hit points with a firearm attack, and kill them, you regain 1 spent grit point.
You also regain all spent grit points after finishing a short or long rest.

sheet.description: You have {{grit-points}} Grit points. You regain 1 when you score or a critical hit, or when you kill a significant threat. You also regain all spent grit points after finishing a short or long rest.

description.p: You learn two trick shots of your choice, which are detailed under “Trick Shots” below. Many maneuvers enhance an attack in some way. Each use of a trick shot must be declared before the attack roll is made. You can use only one trick shot per attack. You learn an additional trick shot of your choice at 7th, 10th, 15th, and 18th level. Each time you learn a new trick shot, you can also replace one trick shot you know with a different one.
Saving Throws. Some of your Trick Shots require your target to make a saving throw to resist the effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

center.p: Trick Shot save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + Dexterity modifier.

description.p: When you reach 7th level, you add your proficiency bonus to your initiative. You can also stow a firearm, then draw another firearm as a single object interaction on your turn.

sheet.description: Stow and draw firearms as a single object interaction on your turn. Also add your proficiency bonus to your intitiative.

description.p: Starting at 10th level, you can reload any firearm as an item interaction.

sheet.description: Reloading any firearm is an item interaction.

description.p: Starting at 15th level, when you roll initiative and have no Grit remaining, you regain 1 grit.

sheet.description: When you roll initiative and have no Grit remaining, you regain 1 Grit.

description.p: At 18th level, your firearm attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19-20.

sheet.description: Firearm attacks score a critical hit on 19-20.

description.p: Upon reaching 18th level, whenever you score a critical hit on an attack with a firearm, the target additionally suffers half of the damage from the attack at the end of its next turn.

sheet.description: On a Critical hit with a firearm, the target suffers half of the damage from the attack at the end of its next turn.

description.p: When you make a firearm attack against a creature, you can expend one grit point to attempt to dizzy your opponent. On a hit, the creature suffers normal damage and must make a Constitution saving throw or suffer disadvantage on attacks until the end of their next turn.

description.p: When you make a firearm attack against a creature, you can expend one grit point to gain advantage on the attack roll.

description.p: When you make a firearm attack against a creature, you can expend one grit point to attempt to shoot an object from their hands. On a hit, the creature suffers normal damage and must succeed on a Strength saving throw or drop 1 held object of your choice and have that object be pushed 10 feet away from you.

On a hit, the creature suffers normal damage and you make an attack roll with disadvantage against every creature in a line directly behind the target within your first range increment.
